body: ### Description Hi! Since switching to Neovim `0.11` Omnisharp stopped respecting my `.editorconfig`. I'm working only with Unity Here's how I configure the lsp: ```lua vim.lsp.config.omnisharp = { capabilities = capabilities, root_markers = { "*.sln", ".git", ".editorconfig" }, settings = { FormattingOptions = { EnableEditorConfigSupport = true }, RoslynExtensionsOptions = { EnableAnalyzersSupport = true, EnableDecompilationSupport = true } }, cmd = { "omnisharp", "--languageserver" } } vim.lsp.enable({ 'omnisharp' }) ``` And here's my `.editorconfig` ```editorconfig root = true # C# files [*.cs] # Indentation and spacing indent_style = space indent_size = 2 insert_final_newline = true # Code style rules csharp_new_line_before_open_brace = all csharp_prefer_braces_for_statement = true csharp_preserve_single_line_blocks = true ``` Before formatting | After formatting :---:|:---: |

comment_data.body:
Just glancing at your code, you probably should be calling `vim.lsp.config('omnisharp', {...})` (which "merges" with the default config) instead of assigning `vim.lsp.config.omnisharp = ...` (which overwrites the default config). 

And that indicates you didn't read `:help lsp-config`. Read `:help lsp-config` to ensure you are using it properly. 

> Since switching to Neovim `0.11` Omnisharp stopped respecting my `.editorconfig`.

In no way does that imply a bug in Nvim nor nvim-lspconfig. You need to debug your own config.
Are you sure that this is not a bug? If yes, then would you mind giving me any pointers on how to debug it?

> https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig?tab=readme-ov-file#troubleshooting

I had in mind something more specific, but thanks.

title: Omnisharp dosen't respect .editorconfig settings
